page.title: 15COMMUNICATION-PLAYING PLACE
page.content: Eight out of every ten people in Playing Place have house{telephones.}A local call costs 10p but you can dial almost any place in the world. There is one post office counter in our area and 08 postboxes where you can post{letters}but not{parcels.}A first class postage stamp costs 17p and a second class, 13p. Usually a first class letter arrives within two days of posting. Emergency services like police, ambulance and fire engines use{radio}communication. There are special{emergency frequencies}and the range is about 50 miles.{Citzen Band {radio}has been legal for 5 years enabling anyone to use certain frequencies. The range is about 10 miles. {Radio amateurs}use short wave radio to talk people all over the world. Sometimes they use the{Morse Code. {
